name: Dengeir of Stuhn

aspects.high_concept: Ousted Jarl and Wary Old Nord
aspects.trouble: Paranoid and Bitter About Loss of Title

stunts: Seen It All: +2 to Will when defending against fear or intimidation, due to Dengeir's seasoned nerves.
Old Nordic Wisdom: Once per session, can use Lore in place of Contacts to recall an old connection or piece of historical info that can help in the present situation.
notes: Dengeir is an elderly Nord noble who ruled Falkreath in the past. He stepped down (or was pressured out) in favor of his nephew Siddgeir, a change he suspects was orchestrated by Imperial supporters. Dengeir is proud and possesses a soldier's memory of past wars. He often mutters about 'Thalmor plots' or unseen threats. Though age has slowed him, his mind is still sharp in matters of intrigue.

motivations: Protect Falkreath from hidden threats (vampires, conspiracies)
See Skyrim free of Thalmor and Imperial meddling
personality_traits.attitude_towards_players: Cautiously hopeful. If players show respect or share information, he warms up, seeing them as potential allies to right wrongs. Skeptical of those aligned with the Empire.
personality_traits.voice_style: Gravelly and low, often hushed as if someone might be listening. Carries an undercurrent of resentment when speaking of current authorities.

relationships.Jarl Siddgeir: Nephew. Dengeir feels Siddgeir is unfit and only in power due to Imperial bribes. Relations are strained at best.
relationships.Thalmor: Deep hatred; he believes the Thalmor (and their concordat) indirectly led to his removal. Blames them for many of Skyrim's woes.
relationships.Stormcloaks: Allies; he quietly supports the Stormcloak cause and Ulfric Stormcloak, hoping they will restore him as Jarl.
relationships.Steward Nenya: Wary respect; acknowledges her capability but suspects her of being too loyal to Siddgeir or the Empire.
